title: Game won't install, getting Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 Redistributable (x64) Error
body:
I just got a brand new HP Pavillion 17 with WIndows 10 and tried to download league this morning, but I couldn't and ran into a couple of errors. The first one say Microsoft VisualC++ 2005 Redistributable (x64). It says "Error 1935 An error occurred during the installation of assembly. Microsoft. VC80. ATL. type="win 32", version 8.05727: 4053." public key token = "1fc8b3b9ale18e3b" processor Architecture = 'amd 64'"

Then it says please refer to help and support from more information. 

THen lastly, it says Visual C ++ 20055P1 Redistributable (x64) mandatory prerequisite was not correctly installed.

This is a brand new computer. Can anybody help? I am about to embark on an 8 hour road trip so I hope to have some answers by then. 

READY, SET, GO!

replies.body:
I hope your roadtrip is both safe and fun!

What you're experiencing is a pretty common error on a brand new machine. What you'll need to do in order to resolve this is run *all available windows updates*, then install [**this**](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=3387) standalone package for C++ 2005. 

Let me know if this worked for you!

Man I wish this roadtrip was over! My mom hit a deer and it blew out our radiator and our heat in bone-chilling CO. I have been trying to update all of the windows updates on this awful inn wifi and it's stuck at 4%. Hopefully I can finish the updates tomorrow and install the standalone package and then I will be good to go. I will keep you updated!

Oh schnitzel, I hope you and your mom are okay! You may have to let those updates run overnight since the PC is new and requires a lot of updates to get current.

Definitely hit me up with an update and try to stay warm out there, bud! :)
Yeah we are ok. We are staying another night while they fix up the car but this wifi keeps going in and out so all the updates haven't loaded yet. Luckily our room is warm!

Finally made it home today and was able to update everything and install the C++ standalone package. So far, it's seemed to work! The client is patching right now, so everything should be good to go. Thanks for all of your help.
